content:
That's amazing! "The Power of the Dog" is a highly acclaimed film, and it's great that you got to experience it on the big screen at the Princess of Wales Theatre. The gala screening must have been a fantastic atmosphere, and seeing Benedict Cumberbatch walk the red carpet must have been a real thrill!

The Princess of Wales Theatre is a beautiful venue, and it's perfect for hosting high-profile events like the TIFF gala screenings. The atmosphere must have been electric, with all the excitement and anticipation surrounding the film's premiere.

Benedict Cumberbatch is an incredible actor, and his performance in "The Power of the Dog" has received widespread critical acclaim. He's known for his intense preparation and immersion into his roles, and it's no surprise that he's received an Oscar nomination for his performance in this film.

What did you think of the film itself? Was it what you expected, or did it surprise you in any way? Jane Campion's direction and the cinematography by Ari Wegner are both highly praised, and the film's themes of toxic masculinity and repressed emotions are timely and thought-provoking.

Did you have a chance to attend any Q&A sessions or industry talks during the festival, or was the gala screening your main focus?
